required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Retrospective Observational Study of Hemoglobin Levels in Patients With Renal Anemia Treated With Mircera (Methoxy Polyethylene Glycol-Epoetin Beta)
clinical_study.official_title: Non-interventional Study of Six-month Retrospective Reporting of Hemoglobin Levels in Patients With Renal Anaemia Who Are Treated With MIRCERAÂ® (Methoxy-polyethylene-glycol-epoetin Beta)

brief_summary.textblock: This retrospective observational study will evaluate the hemoglobin levels in patients with renal anemia over 6 months treatment with Mircera (methoxy polyethylene glycol-epoetin beta).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved a 3-month Hemoglobin Level Stabilization in the Range of 11-12 Grams Per Deciliter (g/dL)
primary_outcome.description: Hemoglobin level stabilization within the range of 11-12 g/dL was measured on a monthly basis according to Kidney Disease Outcomes Quality Initiative (KDOQI) guidelines, for enrolled participants who had received methoxy-polyethylene-glycol-epoetin beta treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved a 6-month Hemoglobin Level Stabilization in the Range of 11-12 g/dL
secondary_outcome.description: Hemoglobin level Level stabilization within the range of 11-12 g/dL was measured on a monthly basis according to KDOQI guidelines, for enrolled participants who had received methoxy-polyethylene-glycol-epoetin beta treatment.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with renal anemia on treatment with Mircera

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients, >/= 18 years of age
- Renal anemia treated with Mircera for at least 6 months before entering study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who refuse or are incapable of giving their written informed consent to retrospective data collection

facility.name: Kyanos Stavros Private Hospital; Nephrologic Clinic
Iatriko Athinon Clinic Dafnis; Nephrology Department
Kyanous Stavros of Patras, Renal Disease Therapy Unit
General Hospital Of Chalkidikis; Dialysis Center Unit
General Hospital of Thessalonikis G.Papanikolaou; Nephrology

group.title: Methoxy-Polyethylene-Glycol-Epoetin Beta
group.description: Participants with renal anemia who were treated with methoxy-polyethylene-glycol-epoetin beta (Mircera, Continuous Erythropoietin Receptor Activator [C.E.R.A]) according to the standard clinical practice, were observed for at least 6 months in this retrospective study.

baseline.population: Baseline population included all enrolled participants.

group.title: Methoxy-Polyethylene-Glycol-Epoetin Beta
group.description: Participants with renal anemia who were treated with methoxy-polyethylene-glycol-epoetin beta according to the standard clinical practice, were observed for at least 6 months in this retrospective study.

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Here, 773 participants were analyzed for this baseline measure (age). Since this is a non-interventional retrospective study participants with missing data were excluded from the analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved a 3-month Hemoglobin Level Stabilization in the Range of 11-12 Grams Per Deciliter (g/dL)
outcome.description: Hemoglobin level stabilization within the range of 11-12 g/dL was measured on a monthly basis according to Kidney Disease Outcomes Quality Initiative (KDOQI) guidelines, for enrolled participants who had received methoxy-polyethylene-glycol-epoetin beta treatment.
outcome.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who had received study treatment and were monitored for hemoglobin level on a monthly basis, according to standard clinical practice. Here, number of participants analyzed signifies those participants who were evaluable for this outcome.

group.title: Methoxy-Polyethylene-Glycol-Epoetin Beta
group.description: Participants with renal anemia who were treated with methoxy-polyethylene-glycol-epoetin beta according to the standard clinical practice, were observed for at least 6 months in this retrospective study.

measure.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who had received study treatment and were monitored for hemoglobin level on a monthly basis, according to standard clinical practice. Here, number of participants analyzed signifies those participants who were evaluable for this outcome.

outcome.description: Hemoglobin level Level stabilization within the range of 11-12 g/dL was measured on a monthly basis according to KDOQI guidelines, for enrolled participants who had received methoxy-polyethylene-glycol-epoetin beta treatment.
outcome.population: Analysis population included all enrolled participants who had received study treatment and were monitored for hemoglobin level on a monthly basis, according to standard clinical practice. Here, number of participants analyzed signifies those participants who were evaluable for this outcome.

group.description: Participants with renal anemia who were treated with methoxy-polyethylene-glycol-epoetin beta according to the standard clinical practice, were observed for at least 6 months in this retrospective study.

reported_events.desc: This was a retrospective study, so the adverse events have already been reported according to the current pharmacovigilance regulations. In addition, this study did not aim to evaluate the safety of methoxy-polyethylene glycol-epoetin beta.

group.title: Methoxy-Polyethylene-Glycol-Epoetin Beta
group.description: Participants with renal anemia who were treated with methoxy-polyethylene-glycol-epoetin beta according to the standard clinical practice, were observed for at least 6 months in this retrospective study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigators is free to publish in reputed journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
